attributes.action: raise the parapets on a road used regulary by horseriders leading to bridleways
attributes.additional_details: the main access to Lullingstone Golf course intails crossing the M25, Most Horses will go over calmly, but some drivers will rev their engines behind the horses when crossing, or Lorry drivers using the M25 often sound their horn.... all these things can spook a horse as horses are flight animals and their main instinct is to run forward at loud noises, it is a matter of time before a horse will spook and run into the parapets and go over onto the very busy section of the M25
